intro: Dobinea vulgaris, commonly known as the common dobinea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has small, ovate leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Dobinea vulgaris is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
